subject: JUnit causes JACOB to hang
msgSnippet: Has anyone else experienced this type of thing?  I m currently working on a project in which I had to use JACOB (See here FMI:
messageBody:
Has anyone else experienced this type of thing? I'm currently working
on a project in which I had to use JACOB (See here FMI:
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/jacob-project/) to access a COM object
via Java. I got my class working correctly and was quite happy.

However, once I tried to write a JUnit test for it, it mysteriously
ceased working. After spending about a day and a half on the issue we
tried, in desperation, moving the whole shebang to another developer's
environment wherein it worked beautifully.

That developer was then tasked with writing the JUnit test, but before
he could do so he had to apply the JUnit JAR files to his Eclipse
environment. Immediately the COM accessing class failed once more.

Curious, we uninstalled the JUnit JAR from my environment and lo and
behold, the class began working again.

So, obviously there is some conflict between JUnit and JACOB. I'm
using JUnit 3.8.1 and JACOB 1.8. Any help or assistance would be
greatly appreciated.

JV
